title: The Living mammal
brief_description: Common characteristics held by all mammals. Various ways in which mammals have adapted themselves to life in the water, air, treetops and on the ground. The highly developed senses of sight, smell, touch and hearing combined in the hunt for food. The adaptations of teeth for herbivorous, carnivorous and ominivorous modes of life. Methods of self-protection and ways in which different mammals care for and rear their young.
